project.projectDescription: A researcher was interested in determining if working on a research project as an undergraduate provided a better chance of getting accepted into a graduate program. Four hundred students were surveyed on campus asking what their college GPA was and if they were on a research project or not.
project.dataDescription:
https://www.kaggle.com/mohansacharya/graduate-admissions
Data was pulled from this dataset. The columns kept are CGPA which is the college undergraduate grade point average. Research is another column with 1 being yes and 0 being no for if the student was on a research project. The Admit column was the chances the student would be admitted to the graduate program they wanted.
project.researchQuestion: Does working on a research project during a student’s undergraduate influence the chances of getting accepted into the graduate program they chose?
project.conclusion: There is evidence that a student’s college grade point average (GPA) and if they were on a research project gives them a higher chance of being accepted into the graduate school they applied to. Being a research assistant gives them almost a 4% higher chance of being accepted into the graduate program they applied to.
